logic

Class LoadPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.LoadPattern

  • public class LoadPattern
extends java.lang.Object
    Reading and decoding RLE patterns from either files or URL. Game of Life patterns is commonly saved as RLE files/URL's. This class reads these files/URLs and decodes them to a byte[][]. Sending them to the Gameboard, and there the user is granted the oppertunity to place the loaded pattern(byte[][]) desierably.

    • Method Detail

      • readGameBoardFromURL

        public byte[][] readGameBoardFromURL()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads patterns from the web. Initiating a urlDialog, sending the URL String created as a URL object to readGameboard.
        Returns:
        the decoded data represented in a byte[][].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown and a dialog is shown to the user.
        See Also:
        urlDialog(), readGameboard(java.io.Reader)

      • urlDialog

        public java.lang.String urlDialog()
        Initiates a JavaFX TextInputDialog object that allows the user to type in a URL direction. This metode is initiated by the readGameboardFromURL metode.
        Returns:
        url.get() url.get() is the URL represented as a String.
        See Also:
        readGameBoardFromURL()

      • readGameboardFromFile

        public byte[][] readGameboardFromFile()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Loads patterns from a local file. Initiating a fileDialog, letting the user choose the file to be read and decoded.
        Returns:
        the decoded data represented in a byte[][].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IOException is thrown and a dialog is shown to the user.
        See Also:
        fileDialog.

      • fileDialog

        public java.io.File fileDialog()
        Initiates a JavaFX FileChooser object that allows the user choose a file from his/her local disc. This metode is initiated by the readGameboardFromFile metode.
        Returns:
        contains the location data for the file on the disc.
        See Also:
        readGameboardFromFile()

      • readGameboard

        public byte[][] readGameboard(java.io.Reader r)
        Reads source data from URL/File. Reads through the source by using a Reader referance, and creates a StringBuilder object based on the characters in the source. Sending the StringBuilder to the decodeHeader(StringBuilder builder).
        Parameters:
        r - is a Reader reference.
        Returns:
        is the decoded data represented in a 2D byte array.
        See Also:
        decodeHeader(java.lang.StringBuilder)

      • decodeHeader

        public byte[][] decodeHeader(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Collects header information based on source data. This method uses the Pattern and Matcher classes to retrieve x and y information to the byte[][] that will represent the pattern when it has been decoded. It also retrieves a ruleset, that represents the rules that goes along with the pattern.
        Parameters:
        builder - is a StringBuilder object that contains the String data of the source.
        Returns:
        the decoded data represented in a byte[][].

      • decodePattern

        public byte[][] decodePattern(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Decodes the pattern logic. This metode uses the Pattern and Matcher classes of Java, to decode the board representation logic from the source. Returning null if patternLogic equals null.
        Decoder description:
        o = 1
        b = 0
        2o = 11
        3b = 000
        3$ = y += 3
        ! = end
        Parameters:
        builder - is a StringBuilder object that contains the String data from the source.
        Returns:
        the decoded data represented in a byte[][].

      • getPatternLogic

        public java.lang.String[] getPatternLogic(java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Returnes the pattern logic section from the source. This metode separates the pattern logic section from the rest of the String data in the source. And splits that data to a String[], splitted on pattern lines. The String[] is used in the decodePattern.
        Parameters:
        builder - is a StringBuilder object that contains the String data of the source.
        Returns:
        is a String[] containing splitted pattern logic.
        See Also:
        decodePattern(java.lang.StringBuilder)

      • addToRealX

        public int addToRealX(int number,
                      int xIndex)
        Adding number to realX. Adding the number to the realX param, subtracting 1.
        Parameters:
        number - the numbers from the pattern logic
        xIndex - the pattern array index.
        Returns:
        the pattern array index.

      • assignValues

        public void assignValues(int number,
                         int yIndex,
                         int xIndex,
                         byte value)
        Assigns values to the byte[][]. This byte[][] is the decoded pattern.
        Parameters:
        number - is numbers from the pattern logic.
        yIndex - is the y index we are at in the decoding cycle.
        xIndex - is the pattern array index.
        value - represents dead or live cells, being either 1 or 0.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates a toString containing, name, size, rules, rawpattern and the decoded pattern for this class.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        name, sizes, ruleset, rawpattern and the byte[][] represented in a String.
